Resort Guidelines - Belle Parc RV Resort Skip to content Address: 11050 Elliots Way, Brooksville, Florida 34601 Tel:(352) 593-5852 info@belleparcrvresorts.com Email Call Us Call Us Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Search for: Search Search Main Menu Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Search for: Search Search Main Menu Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Resort Guidelines Home Resort Guidelines AN ACTIVE 55+ YEAR-ROUND RESORT GUIDELINES & POLICIES As our guest, your comfort, enjoyment, and safety are first and foremost. Please take a moment to familiarize yourself with our policies and guidelines. It is your responsibility to read and observe resort policies and guidelines. OFFICE HOURS: (October 1 st – April 15 th ) Monday through Friday 9am-5pm; Saturday  10am – 4pm, closed Sunday.  (April 15 th – September 30 th ) Monday through Friday 10am-3pm. Closed on Saturday and Sunday.   Late check-ins (after the office is closed) will only be permitted with advance notice and you must arrive prior to sunset. Parking is not permitted after dark. MAIL CENTER – CONCIERGE HOURS: (October 1 st – April 15 th ) – Monday through Saturday 9am-5pm. Sunday Closed.  For (April 15 th – September 30 th ), please check with the Office. ARRIVALS – DEPARTURES – RESERVATIONS: Guest check out time is 11:30 am and check in time is 12pm, unless arrangements are made with the office by 10am the day prior to your arrival or departure. If you arrive before 12pm your site may not be available. Deviations from these times must be approved and may incur fees. Quiet time must be observed from 10pm to 8am. Residents are responsible for their guests’ behavior. Management reserves the right to refuse entry to or dismiss any person and their property from the resort without refund. MAIL AND GARBAGE: Mail is delivered to and sorted in our Mail Center.  It is your responsibility to pick up your mail at this location.  There is a box provided for all outgoing mail, located in front of the Mail Center.  Our mailing address is 11050 Elliots Way. Belle Parc will forward mail, not to exceed 12 ounces, if you provide labels for that purpose, for up to 6 weeks after your departure.  Garbage containers are located behind the shop, next to our off-site storage, and in the back of resort site area. GATE ACCESS: Your gate code is used on the key pad entering the gate. Please do not give out the gate code to anyone – this is for your and all of our guests’ security.  Our gate will remain open 7 days a week during office hours. VEHICLES: RVs 10 years or older require prior approval by management; unacceptable RVs may be refused. A picture of all 4 sides must be submitted before approval will be given and pictures must match the current RV condition.  No tents or pop-ups allowed. No more than 2 vehicles per site (providing they fit on your concrete), excluding 1 golf cart. All golf carts must be electric and drivers of carts must have a valid drivers’ license. Please, no parking on grass; limited overflow parking is available upon request. Boats, tow trailers, dollies, storage trailers, etc. must be stored in our designated off-site storage area.  On-site repairs to vehicles or RVs without prior approval from management are prohibited. WASHING OF VEHICLES: You may wash your vehicle and RV one time upon your initial arrival at your site. Additional washes will be charged ($5.00 vehicles; $25 RVs and Park Models). SOLICITATION – BUSINESS OPERATIONS: Solicitation and operation of a business are prohibited on Resort property. BUILDINGS & GROUNDS: No hand washing of clothing or dish washing within our bathrooms. Pet items should be washed only in the designated washer/dryer in the maintenance building laundry area. No glass or smoking in our pool area. No alcohol in pool or spa. No pets in any building or common use areas (pool/spa area, laundry areas, bathrooms, etc.) Smoking is only allowed at the fire pit behind the Activity Center and on your site. YOUR SITE: Guests are encouraged to maintain their sites in a neat and orderly manner.  Storage of any kind is not permitted around or under your RV.  Screen rooms, clothes lines, temporary canvas pop-ups and pet fences are not allowed. Larger RVs must have blocks under leveling jacks, available at the office for use during your stay (refundable deposit required.) No permanent structures are allowed for guests staying less than 6 months, including plantings. Campfires are permitted only in above ground pits and shall be attended to at all times. Sewer rings (positive seal) are required by state law for all sewer connections. Water pressure in the resort is high and use of a water pressure regulator is recommended. Portable storage boxes and permanent sheds for your site, alterations, improvements, or additions to your site must have the written approval of management and any required permits shall be obtained by the guest. Management reserves the right to determine the appropriateness of all outdoor items. PETS: We strive hard to be a pet friendly resort, so please read and follow our pet policies. We currently allow 2 pets per site. Aggressive behavior and excessive noise will not be allowed. Pets must be under owner’s control and attended to at all times.  Pets must remain on a 4′-6′ fixed-length leash and within 4′ to 6′ of the owner at all times, except in our leash-free dog run. Pet enclosures are not allowed. Remember to keep your pet(s) within our roadway surfaces and off other guests’ sites when walking your pet(s). Please pick up and dispose of pet waste immediately. Pets are not allowed in any common use areas, any buildings, or in the pool area. For your safety and that of your pets, please do not feed stray animals or any wildlife in the resort. Bird feeders are acceptable. Failure To Comply With Our Pet Guidelines Will Result: 1st offense        Verbal Warning 2nd offense       $50.00 Fine 3rd offense        Your reservation will be cancelled DISCLAIMER: Belle Parc RV Resort is private property and is not responsible for any loss due to limbs falling, branches, fire, accident, theft, or for any loss, damage, or injury to any resident or guest of resident, or property of either, from any cause. Additionally, Belle Parc RV Resort is not responsible for damage by lawn or maintenance equipment to any items that are left on any site. Guests waive any right to royalties or other compensation arising or related to the use guests’ image or recording.  Management reserves the right to amend these guidelines at any time and without notice, or to evict any person violating these guidelines and policies, or who, in the management’s sole judgment, adversely affects the enjoyment of other guests or staff in the resort. Further, management may enforce a guideline or policy that is not listed here at any time or may make an exception to any guideline or policy on a guest-by-guest special consideration basis. TERMINATION OF ANY GUEST’S RESERVATION IS WITHOUT REFUND. Scout Reviewed Sep. 1, 2025 Belle parc is a very relaxing campground So check in was easy and the ladies at the front office where amazing and very hospitable.  We were shown to our campsite by a very nice gentleman. He even helped us back in and hook up.  As for the stay it’s been very relaxing and quiet. The shower houses are awesome.  We backed up to one of the lakeside areas where the fishing was excellent. We were Also located next to a pool and it was very clean with limited activity from other guest. Would definitely recommend to stay again. Site 71 Month of Visit August Share Report d dee L. Traveler Reviewed Oct. 8, 2021 Beautiful Park Easy access to this beautiful park. We were escorted to our site. There are MANY rules here, such as your wheels must be 18” from the grass, no part of your RV can extend past the concrete pad, which can be tricky because of the hookup locations. Pads are all concrete, but nothing is very level.  Bathrooms/showers look to be recently updated. The pool and hot tub are very nice. The quietness is great.  Would definitely visit again, but their in-season rates are $$$$$. Share Report Showing results 1- 2 of 2 reviews For information regarding reservations, contact this campground directly. USD / Night See Details (3) Photos Overview Rates Map (3) Reviews Overview 11089 Ancient Trail, Brooksville, FL, 34601 Belle Parc is an Active 55+ RV Resort. If you are looking for more than just your ordinary campground or RV park, you have to experience "Belle Parc", French for "beautiful park", and our country quiet charm. Belle Parc RV Resort is located on West Central Florida's Adventure Coast in Hernando County and is 4 miles from downtown Brooksville. We offer country quiet with big city accessibility. Belle Parc RV Resort's location offers local access to gulf beaches, rivers and springs for kayaking, canoeing, fishing, or just relaxing. The Good Neighbor Trail, Suncoast Trail and the Withlacoochee "Rails to Trails" are nearby paved, dedicated bicycle trails. Croom State Park offers off-road bike & ATV trails. Our rural location offers great motorcycle excursions. We are a short distance to Disney, Busch Gardens, Weeki Wachee Springs and Water Park, Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park, and Citrus County Speedway. We are a full-service park, with spacious sites and full hookups, and arrival escort to your site. During your stay with us, we offer a seasonally heated pool, hot-tub, laundry facilities, sparkling restrooms, and an exercise room. Complimentary Wi-Fi and HD Cable is available at all sites. High-Speed Internet is available at your site for an additional fee. We anticipate further upgrades and amenities as we continue our growth into the winter season 2017-2018 and beyond. . We are Big-Rig friendly and, subject to management's approval, rigs over 10 years old are welcomed. We are a pet-friendly park. We invite you to browse our site and visit our links to area attractions and information. Feel free to contact us with any questions or comments at info@belleparcrvresorts.com as we grow our "beautiful park" - Belle Parc to better serve you. Belle Parc RV Resort is a pet friendly RV park located on 11089 Ancient Trail in Brooksville, FL. The site includes WiFi, water, sewer, showers, electricity. You can also do activities such as Shuffleboard, badminton, and swimming outdoors. The campground is open all year. Last Updated: 11/15/2024 Rates RV Sites Options Starting Daily Starting Weekly Starting Monthly Lake Front $80.00 $500.00 Premium $70.00 $400.00 Standard $55.00 $325.00 Cottages Options Starting Daily Starting Weekly Starting Monthly Cottage -- $700.00 Rules Vehicle Policy RVs 10 years or older require prior approval by management; unacceptable RVs may be refused. No "homemade", school buses, tents, pop-ups, vans, truck campers, or conversion vans are permitted without prior approval from management. No more than 2 vehicle per site (providing they fit on your concrete), excluding 1 golf cart. All golf carts must be electric & drivers of carts must have a valid license. Please, no parking on grass; overflow parking is available upon request. Boats, tow trailers, storage trailers, etc. must be stored in our designated off-site storage area. On-site repairs to vehicles or RVs without prior approval from management are prohibited.
WASHING OF VEHICLES:
You may wash your vehicle and RV one time upon your initial arrival at your site. Additional washes will require a permit from the office. Pet Policy We strive hard to be a pet friendly park, so please no pets in any buildings and please read and follow our pet policies (separate attachment). We currently allow 2 outside pets and 1 inside pet. Aggressive behavior and excessive noise will not be allowed. Pets must be under owner's control and attended to at all times, on a 4'-6' fixed-length leash and within 4' to 6' of the owner, except in our leash-free dog runs. Remember to keep your pet(s) within our roadway surfaces and off other guests' sites and common use areas when walking your pet to any of our designated pet areas. JANUARY 2023 NEWSLETTER - Belle Parc RV Resort Skip to content Address: 11050 Elliots Way, Brooksville, Florida 34601 Tel:(352) 593-5852 info@belleparcrvresorts.com Email Call Us Call Us Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Search for: Search Search Main Menu Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations Search for: Search Search Main Menu Homepage About Resort Info Menu Toggle Area Info and Things To Do Contact Newsletters Resort Activities Rates Resort Calendar Resort Map Resort Guidelines Amenities Photos Menu Toggle Activities Park Views Sales Reservations JANUARY 2023 NEWSLETTER Newsletters / January 25, 2023 I hope everyone is having a wonderful 2023.  We are still busy and hard at work improving our Resort and adding to our Guest Services / Activities for the remainder of the winter season and beyond.  The holiday season from Thanksgiving to Christmas and New Year’s was active and festive.  Thanks to all staff and volunteers for the beautiful decorations, wonderful meals and fun activities. A covered outdoor activity area has recently been installed behind the Activity Center.  This area is for guest use for informal and personal enjoyment.  If you plan a group activity that you wish to be held there, please coordinate with the Guest Service staff to make sure your event does not interfere with another planned event.  Only guest services staff can approve group activities.  As always, private events are not allowed in Belle Parc community buildings or areas. We will begin serving more meals out of our Activity Center kitchen . The first breakfast is scheduled for Saturday, January 21. Watch for your Sunday email from Glenn Woods, our Guest Services Director for more information, and see below for more Activity updates. Our thanks to the guests coordinating the Friday Fireside activity.  This has been a big hit and we are happy that the fire pit area is getting a lot of use this year.  Please let our staff know if more wood needs to be brought to that area. Improvements to the Pavilion continue; we have added a dance floor area in front of the stage.  We plan to expand this area; we had a great turnout on New Year’s Eve and that area was full.  Lighting outside the Pavilion has been improved and we will be adding reflective road markers in the cross-walk area between the Pavilion and the Fitness Center restrooms.  Whenever permits and inspections allow for further improvements, restrooms will be installed inside the Pavilion. The Corn Hole games and Shuffleboard courts have new score towers installed.  New Shuffleboard cue sticks have been purchased.  We appreciate Derrick and Diane coordinating this activity. We plan to install a guest area in Phase 3 (the premium sites and park models bounded by the farm, the Nature Reserve and the subdivision).  Plans are for this to be a stand-alone gazebo-type area with built-in seating.  Details will follow. Belle Parc has sold the last of our Park Models on site. Please do not drop “slap” weights in the Fitness Center.  This causes the cables to fall off the pulleys and will eventually break the ropes.  When you add more weight over your strength limit, it can lead to injuries. Please make sure that you have added only the weights that you can execute without breaking form. Clanking the weights is also is not good for your workout (it takes pressure off the muscle being worked). If you hear a loud “boom”, it could be the CEMEX Brooksville Cement Plant and Quarry operations. They are located at the intersection of Yontz and Cobb Roads and mine rock for concrete, aggregates and related products. Please see more information below from our Maintenance, Activity, Reservation and Mail Center staff. Welcome to our guests who have arrived since our previous seasonal newsletters were published.  If you did not receive a copy, you can pick one up in the Mail Center, Activity Office or Welcome Center TV / Internet Café room on the table just outside the reservation office. These can also be accessed from our website http://www.belleparcrvresorts.com/ .  The link Current Newsletter is just below the photo banner on the home page.  There is a lot of important information on these newsletters and I recommend you read them.  If you are unable to access them from the website, please send an email to office@belleparvrcresorts.com and I will email you a copy. I am developing a Frequently Asked Questions page on our website in the hopes that newsletters can be streamlined for our guests who stay the year or season, but also give new guests important information on the Resort that is easily  accessible.  I will continue to send weekly emails to current guests as needed for reminders, notices and concerns. Thank you for choosing Belle Parc for your stay.  If there is anything I can do to make your stay more enjoyable, please contact me at office@belleparcrvresorts.com Theresa Woods, Resort Manager GUEST SERVICES You should receive an email every Sunday with that week’s activity information listed.  If you are not receiving these, please let us know.  The following activities will occur between now and the end of the season.  Detailed information will be sent via the Sunday email as information becomes available.  Please check the Monthly Calendar and Recurring Activities List each week, as these change throughout the season as events are continually being added and/or updated. Saturday Breakfast weekly Tuesday and Thursday dinners weekly Super Bowl Party (Tim Fisk at Site #40 is selling squares at various price-points if you are interested see him for the squares. If he is not available, please see our activity staff.) Beginner Line Dancing Classes Euchre Tournament CPR/First Aid/AED training for staff and guests. Valentine’s Card Stitching Class Valentine’s Day Dinner and Dance Dinner Cruise Pot Luck Chili Cookoff St. Patrick’s Day Dinner and Dance More Meet N Greet Live Music Blood Drive Medicare Seminar Yard Sale Craft Fair Ladies’ Luncheon Hudson Dinner Theatre – Buddy Holly or Sister Act Volunteer and Staff Appreciation Day, March 17 Guest Appreciation Day, March 24 Thanks to all our volunteers who make some of our activities possible. As you can tell by our recurring activity list and other activities and functions that we communicate via Channel 3 and emails, we could not offer as wide a variety of things to do without your help.  If you are interested in leading an activity, a class, or a group, please let us know by visiting the Activity Office, by calling the office at 352-593-5852, or by emailing us at activities@belleparcrvresorts.com . Propane Delivery – Sunrise Propane delivers propane for Class A, Class B or Class C motorhomes only.  Payment is due upon receipt and you must be present.  Deliveries are on Wednesdays. The Signup sheet is now permanently located in the Mail Center year-round on the bulletin board. If you have portable tanks, the closest place to take them is Tractor Supply Company, 18741 Cortez Blvd. in Brooksville. Their phone number is 352-799-2551. Cable TV channel 3 is a guest guide and includes important information about Belle Parc procedures, regulations and activities. Books, puzzles and games are stored in the Activity Center for guests’ use.  There are also books in the TV room in the Welcome Center and more paperback books are in the Fitness Center cabinets. Activity sign-up sheets are still in the inside hallway of the Activity Center for scheduled and recurring activities. Copies of calendars and recurring activities are available at the entrance to the Activity Center, the TV room in the Welcome Center and the Mail Center. Facebook Posts https://www.facebook.com/groups/friendsinbelleparc.com There is a public Friends In Belle Parc group on Facebook that is available for guests to communicate with each other.  If you would like to be added to that group, search for the group within Facebook or follow the above link to send a request to be added to the group.  If you experience difficulties, let our Guest Services staff know by stopping by the Activity Office or by sending us an email to activities@belleparcrvresorts.com .  If you need service or have a question for Belle Parc staff, please call the office.  We strive to post activity communications to this group but do not monitor it as closely as we do our emails. Any questions or problems will be addressed more thoroughly and quickly by contacting the appropriate staff. Glenn  Woods, Guest Services Director GROUNDS AND MAINTENANCE If you need assistance with any maintenance, grounds, modem or IT issues, please contact the office and they will complete a work order request so service requests can be prioritized. We have fulfilled over 500 work order requests since October 1.  We appreciate your patience; we process all work orders, including for Internet as soon as possible, most of the time on the same day of the request. Mike Fuller, Grounds and Maintenance Supervisor RESERVATION OFFICE Greetings to our new and returning guests. We would like to remind our guests as the busy time is here, you can come down to the Reservation office to sign up to get your bills paid automatically by signing the credit card authorization form . It only takes a few minutes to do this.  We are not authorized to charge your card on file without your specific approval for each use.  Without the credit card authorization on file, you will need to come to or contact the office on or before your check-in day each month to pay your bill. We also take invoice payments with your approval by email for your convenience. In the Reservation Office we also have rolls of quarters for you to buy; rolls of $10 only. We are selling jackets, sweatshirts, hooded sweatshirts, golf shirts, t-shirts (hats will be arriving soon) in a variety of great colors with the Belle Parc logo. Season 2023-2024 reservations – we will have an “open house” for 2023-2024 reservations as soon as rates have been approved by our corporate office. This includes renewals for our yearly guests. We will send out an email to all registered guests outlining the process and deadlines.  Flyers will be posted on all buildings and message/bulletin boards.  If you expect to be away from the resort during that time, please ask the office for a Renewal Request for 2023 – 2024 Season. The first phase will be for guests who want to remain on their current sites and the second phase will be for current guests who want to move to another site.  More details will be distributed soon. The Welcome Center TV room is open to guests after office hours to hang out with friends or family, play games at the tables, check out the Belle Parc and Nature Coast concierge binders, pick up activity related literature, watch TV or just check out our library with a variety of books.  The Help Desk is an office workstation in this area and we ask that guests not use this area during the day for gatherings. Feel free to come in anytime to pick up a book or resort information or to use the Internet Café for limited times. Rhonda, Kim, Susan, Deb MAIL CENTER The Mail Center received a total of 2,318 packages during December . Thank you for your patience as it takes awhile to sort and place mail in the personal, locked mail boxes. Please help us keep our small storage area available for new mail by picking up your mail, especially packages, as soon after they are delivered as possible.  We notify guests when packages arrive either by email or phone call.  Bins are available for smaller packages and the key to the appropriate bin will be in your mail box. Please return it after use to the locked key box on the front counter.  The lobby and mail boxes are accessible 7 days a week, 24-hours a day. You will need to have your mail box key.  Staff will not give mail to anyone across the counter. Quarter rolls and a limited number of stamps are also for sale in the Mail Center.  We have free fax and copying capability. Notifications will be sent to current residents via email, Facebook and posted on the Concierge bulletin boards and the Sandwich Boards outside the lodge. Belle Parc is located within a short distance to three paved, dedicated bike trails; an off-road bike trail; and several lakes and rivers and gulf access locations for water activities. Group bike and kayaking trips are scheduled when weather permits and at guests’ request Unscheduled group motorcycle trips are available to tour the scenic roadways in the area. Activities Available (April – October) For the most up-to-date information, please view our Calendar under Resort Info 3 Pickleball Courts The Fire Pit in back of the lodge is for guest use any time. The Grill at the pool area, please schedule with office . Pool and Spa close at dark. Shuffleboard Courts and Corn-Hole Boards are available for use any time. DVDs are available in the Activity Center for Walking, Pilates, Aerobic Exercises and Yoga . Exercise mats and exercise ball are available in the Fitness Center. The Fitness Center is open every day. Treadmill, stationary bikes, stair stepper, inversion table, exercise ball, hand weights, bench press and weight machine are available. DVD and VHS movies are available any day and time the Activity Center is open. Movies can be viewed in your RV and returned to the Library before your departure. Books, Magazines and Books On Tape are available in the Activity Center, the Welcome Center and in the Fitness Center cabinets . Guests are encouraged to swap out books for replacements from their own library. Jigsaw Puzzles and various Board Games, Cards and Poker Sets are available in the Activity Center and Welcome Center . Sewing Machines, Ironing Boards, Irons and sewing magazines are available in the Activity Center . An Active 55+ resort. If you are looking for more than just your ordinary campground or RV park, you have to experience “Belle Parc”, French for “beautiful park”, and our country quiet charm. Belle Parc RV Resort is located on West Central Florida’s Adventure Coast in Hernando County and is 4 miles from downtown Brooksville. We offer country quiet with big city accessibility. View Our Guest Guide Our Location The Good Neighbor Trail, Suncoast Trail and the Withlacoochee “Rails to Trails” are nearby paved, dedicated bicycle trails. Croom State Park offers off-road bike & ATV trails. Our rural location offers great motorcycle excursions. We are a short distance to Disney, Busch Gardens, Weeki Wachee Springs and Water Park, Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park, and Citrus County Speedway. Big Rig Friendly Belle Parc RV Resort is Big-Rig friendly and, subject to management’s approval, rigs over 10 years old are welcomed. We are a pet-friendly park. Full Service Park We are a full-service park, with spacious sites and full hookups, and arrival escort to your site. During your stay with us, we offer a seasonally heated pool, hot-tub, laundry facilities, sparkling restrooms, and an exercise room. Complimentary Wi-Fi and HD Cable is available at all sites. High-Speed Internet is available at your site for an additional fee. We anticipate further upgrades as we continue the expansion of park amenities. Check Us Out We invite you to browse our site and visit our links to area attractions and information. Feel free to contact us with any questions or comments at info@belleparcrvresorts.com as we grow our “beautiful park” – Belle Parc to better serve you. Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area.
